Sorry if this is a duplicate bug, took a look in bugzilla and couldnt find anything similar.

I just installed 1.0.0. I had 0.9.1 previously installed. I get this error message in my TaskList View when i start eclipse.

I've switched back to 0.9.1 for now and it still works.

Nathan, this means that Mylar failed to start.  The original exception would be far down a stack trace, but I'm guessing that you got bit by the update manager bug.  Please see the instructions here: http://wiki.eclipse.org/index.php/Mylar_FAQ#Installation_Troubleshooting

If you could update again, ensuring that you use Search for New Features, and let me know how that goes that would be great.

Mik,

I disabled my 0.9.1 installation restarted eclipse. 
Then uninstalled both 1.0.0 and 0.9.1 and restarted.
Checked my Eclipse Configuration (read help->software updates->manage configuration) To make sure there were no mylar packages installed. There were none.  Restarted Eclipse again to be safe.

Then went to the update manager and searched for new features at 
download.eclipse.org/technology/mylar/update-site/e3.2

Downloaded 1.0.0 and restarted.  Still getting the same error.

I'll attach a screenshot of my manage config so you can see what other things i have installed.

Created an attachment (id=55499)
Screenshot of Manage Configuration

Nathan: could you please attach the full stack trace?  The origin of he failure should be near the bottom.  I also need to know what exactly what VM ad Eclipse version you are using.  If you're using the Sun VM make sure that you bump up your MaxPermSize too:

http://wiki.eclipse.org/index.php/Mylar_FAQ#I_am_seeing_java.lang.OutOfMemoryError:_PermGen_space_errors.2C_what.27s_wrong.3F

Created an attachment (id=55516)
Dump of the Error Log

Here is the error log from Eclipse regarding the startup error.

Mik,

I've also tried the -XX:MaxPermSize=128M parameter to my eclipse launch. No change. Thanks for trying to figure this out.  I'm dying to use Mylar again!

Also, Java Version 1.5.0 Build (1.5.0_09-b03)
Eclipse Version 3.2.1
Build id: M20060921-0945
Nathan, restarting eclipse on command line with: "eclipse -clean" work for you?
eclipse -Clean yielded the same results. No Dice

I see on the attached stack trace that there is a timeout on phpeclipse. Can you disable this plugin and check if it persists?

If so, I think it is a dup of bug#167784.
Disabled PHP Eclipse and the error persists.

Nathan: if you could post the first exception in the lock list of exceptions that could provide additional evidence.  However, this is almost certainly a duplicate of bug 167784, and the only curiosity that remains is why you're seeing it and others are not, so that we can determine what scenarios others may see it with.  The circularity that we have which is causing this is legal, and its usually the Sun VM that has a problem with it, so to get around this you could try the BEA, IBM, or Java 6 VM.

I expect to make progress on bug 167784 today or tomorrow, and will notify you on this bug when a new build is available so that you can test.  Until then I think the only options for you are to move back to 0.9.1, to try to disable more plug-ins and see if that helps, or to try a different VM.

Also, I'd like to know the minimum environment where you can see this happen.

Can you try to test in a Eclipse + Mylar only installation with a newly created tasklist?

And after that, with this same installation, but point the tasklist to that you are using with the actual workspace?

Also, your machine configuration: processor, how many cores? Are you using some custom option in VM initialization?

(In reply to comment #13)
> Also, I'd like to know the minimum environment where you can see this happen.
> 
> Can you try to test in a Eclipse + Mylar only installation with a newly created
> tasklist?

I downloaded a new eclipse-SDK-3.2.1-win32.zip and then proceeded to install Mylar, task list shows up, Mylar is working! This was with a brand new workspace.

> And after that, with this same installation, but point the tasklist to that you
> are using with the actual workspace?

I then switched to my existing workspace and Mylar showed up and is working once again! Excellent.

If i go back to my old install i'm getting the same errors the mylar isnt starting.  So i'll chalk this up to my install and that i probably have something that isnt quite right with this install.

 
> Also, your machine configuration: processor, how many cores? Are you using some
> custom option in VM initialization?

Its a Intel Pentium M 1.8ghz Dell Laptop, single core, as for custom options i dont think im using any i installed java that was about it.  I'm not a java developer i use Eclipse as my editor for PHP.

I will go ahead and build a new workspace but i wont delete this one as of yet in case you wish to get to the root cause of this.  At this point feel free to close this bug as WORKSFORME or INVALID
Good! Yes, let's leave the "crime scene" untouched until Mik cut a new dev-build and test if it still persists.

Yes, please, we need this crime scene intact ;)  This bug is nearly impossible to reproduce.  Let's discuss further on bug 167784 which describes the core problems, and iterate there once I make a dev build available.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 167784 ***

Nathan: could you please verify the fix to bug 167784 by installing the 1.0.0.v20061219-1530 build from one of the following update sites and running it in the workspace that was causing you problems?  Make sure to use "Search for new features" when updating.

  download.eclipse.org/technology/mylar/update-site/test/e3.2
  download.eclipse.org/technology/mylar/update-site/test/e3.3
Sure thing, did you want me to back up the "crime scene" first?
Yes, but it would be good if you could make a copy of the "crime scene" before doing so just in case.

Sorry for the lack of updates, holidays and all.

On Jan 2nd i downloaded download.eclipse.org/technology/mylar/update-site/test/e3.2

And the same error occured.
